Detailed Description

Reply to a ProximityPositionRequestPacket or ProximityItemSetRequestPacket.

Definition at line 176 of file SharedProximityPackets.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ProximityReplyPacket::ProximityReplyPacket (  ProximityPositionRequestPacket *  inPacket  ) 
 

Answer to a ProximityPositionRequestPacket.

\ Encoded as follows: \ {enumerate} setNumberMaps is called with the total number of maps. The mapID and number of items is set for a map and all items for the map is added. Prevoius step is repeated for all maps. {enumerate}

After the normal header the reply packet contains: {tabular}{lll} Pos & Size & Destription \ REPLY_HEADER_SIZE & 4 bytes & numberMaps \ +4 & 1 bytes & moreHits \ for each Map & 4 bytes & MapID \ end for each & 4 bytes & nbrItems \ for each Map*nbrItems & 4 bytes & ItemID \ {tabular}

ProximityReplyPacket::ProximityReplyPacket (  ProximityItemSetRequestPacket *  inPacket  ) 
 

Answer to a ProximityItemSetRequestPacket.\ See other constructor for encoding.

bool ProximityReplyPacket::addItem (  uint32  itemID,
int &  position
) 
 

Add an item to the packet.

See setNumberItems for information about position.

Returns:
true if the item was added, false if packet was full.

Returns:
the position for the first item for this map. Is only valid if the number of items in the maps before this has been entered.
